Description: Two joining sherds of East Greek, possibly Chian, vessel; either from a strongly carinated shoulder of a closed vase, or a lid; interior reserved; exterior slipped white; 'neck' area glazed with reserved line; on shoulder, goat leaping to left, head lost; legs in silhouette, body and tail dappled; triangles and rosettes as fill; glazed on carination with reserved area at lower break.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.613)
